isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - FRONT AXLE LOCKING HUBS - OPERATION

svcproc.title: ENGAGING THE LOCKING HUBS
svcproc.para: To engage the locking hubs, turn the control dials (one on each hub) clockwise to the "LOCK" position. The arrow in the center of the control dial must point directly at the dot located on the rim of the hub ( Figure 1). The control dial has a distinct feel when it "seats" itself once the dial is properly positioned.

If the arrow on the control dial does not point directly at the dot on the rim cap, the control dial will not seat itself. Thus, the gears inside the hub body will not completely engage and the hub may suffer internal damage.

As the dial (Item 1, Figure 2) is turned towards "LOCK" (clockwise), the clutch ring (Item 2) moves inward towards the inner drive gear (Item 3). The clutch ring links the outside splines of the inner drive gear to the inside splines of the hub body (Item 4).

note.para: Moving the vehicle slightly forward or backward may help to engage the clutch ring to the inner drive gear.
